title: Ttelas
author: Ttelas
content: Marriage is a union between two people that  love each other and ready to spend their lives together but  Most Marriages happened in Nigeria due to political reasons and money . In this our generation in Nigeria most are arranged by the parents of the girl due to political reasons or for the parents to make more money and get more connection . Due to poverty and lack of self esteem, Politicians  of over seventy years can marry girl of sixteen or seventeen in Nigeria. Nowadays it's hard to see people marrying for love.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: It has become quite a norm for some parents to give their children away for selfish purposes. Blame it on the economy and the high inflation hitting the country, but inward, man is greedy and can to any lengths to satisfy that emotion. Also, another factor to be considered is the case of child marriages which are quite normal in the Northern parts of the country. What would you say then is responsible for such occurrence?

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Ttelas on November 27, 2022, 04:24:28 PM   Marriage is a union between two people that  love each other and ready to spend their lives together but  Most Marriages happened in Nigeria due to political reasons and money . In this our generation in Nigeria most are arranged by the parents of the girl due to political reasons or for the parents to make more money and get more connection . Due to poverty and lack of self esteem, Politicians  of over seventy years can marry girl of sixteen or seventeen in Nigeria. Nowadays it's hard to see people marrying for love. Marriage is the coming together of a man and a woman to raise a family because they love each other. But from origin marriages have been used to achieve different goals. Some people see it as a means to achieve other goals. Some people want to get married to a wealthy person because they want to live in abundance. While others are getting married because of social status.But from its origin marriage has been used as a political tool to grad or advance one's power and influence. We have heard of Kings or Princes going to take wives from other kingdoms to gain their support or make them their allies. Currently, most politicians see it as a strategy to get more votes from other states during elections. A governor that wants to become a president needs to advance his support base to other states and marriage might be a good political strategy.
